tweet: Great news for Longview! I was pleased to champion the Tax Cuts & Jobs Act through Congress to create Opportunity Zones like this one for the Beech St. project. Estimated to bring 200 new jobs & $111 million in private investments to the city. Read more ⬇️ https://bit.ly/2mf6Qae

Folks in Southwest Washington should be able to responsibly, and sustainably, harvest products like huckleberries and firewood from our forests for their enjoyment and benefit – this bill I introduced will reauthorize this forestry program. https://www.columbian.com/news/2019/sep/23/bill-would-standardize-rules-for-harvesting-certain-products-from-national-forests/ …
#JobsforSouthwestWA https://www.columbian.com/news/2019/sep/16/vigor-glee-kick-off-construction-of-new-army-landing-craft/ …

Every year I have the honor of nominating a few outstanding individuals to our nation's military service academies. I'm pleased to announce we are now accepting applications! 

For more information and to submit an application, visit my website:  https://herrerabeutler.house.gov/assistingyou/serviceacademynominations.htm … pic.twitter.com/svjf1z3LMO

(2/2) Given this, it was important I cleared up some misinformation in a recent Colombian editorial about improvements to the Endangered Species Act. Get the facts here ⬇️ https://www.columbian.com/news/2019/sep/15/herrera-beutler-columbians-criticism-of-esa-updates-misleading/ …
(1/2) I’ve worked to protect our endangered species - from promoting a healthy @GPNF, to boosting native salmon runs and finding solutions that preserve endangered species.

Affordable housing is a huge concern for Southwest Washington. I'm proud to introduce this bipartisan bill with my colleagues, @RepDennyHeck, @RepTrey & @RepMikeQuigley that encourages communities to prioritize increasing housing supply and affordability. https://bit.ly/2kUvNH0

Native American tribes should be able to pursue the same economic opportunities as non-tribal citizens. 

I was happy to right this wrong when my bipartisan bill passed Congress & was signed into law to repeal this antiquated law. https://washex.am/2kOCA59
Happy 72nd birthday to the @usairforce! Thank you to the brave Airmen defending our country. Aim High! #AirForceBirthday pic.twitter.com/Ryr0EKWbjQ

It was honor to attend @VigorIndustrial's keel laying ceremony. The ceremonial welds I participated in marks the beginning of the MSV(L) program & a new era of shipbuilding in the Aluminum Fabrication facility in Vancouver. By 2023, Vigor expects up to 400 new jobs at its site! pic.twitter.com/WWZdMA1Qos

We have a rich abundance of natural resources in our public forests that benefit rural communities, tribal residents and visitors to our region. I'm pleased to introduce this special forest products bill with my colleague, @RepSchrader. 

Read more ↓ https://herrerabeutler.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=401601 …
Our @USArmy should be fully equipped to handle every threat and mission, and this advance in technology will help our military on land and sea maintain a sharp, defensive edge.

This is an exciting day for the city of Vancouver and the hundreds of jobs that will be created to construct this watercraft. From my position on the House Appropriations Committee, I was happy to lead the effort to support this project. pic.twitter.com/YEqnaVwULN

It was a privilege to attend the keel laying on the first Maneuver Support Vessel (Light) in Vancouver today, (I even got to channel my inner “Wendy the Welder” by welding my name on the vessel)! 💪🏼 pic.twitter.com/hxHW19Nldf

Suicide is a difficult topic for all of us, yet lives can be saved when we open up and talk about our struggles.

We cannot allow Oregon to toll on I-5 and I-205 without providing any benefit to Washington residents. I sent a letter today to Governor Inslee urging him to follow up on his statement that Oregon’s unfair tolling scheme “will not happen.”
